line.en: The birds that fly in the sky can't possibly\nunderstand the feelings of we humans who crawl\nacross the land.
Because birds have wings.
'Asa. Do you know why people admire birds so\nmuch?'
'It's because people can't fly. People are beings\nwithout wings. And people admire what they can't\nreach, and long for it.'
'I think you feel that even more than most\npeople, Asa.'
'I think that's your strong point. I'm sure\nyou'll become the type of person that others look\nup to.'
That's right. I understand.
I understand, Grandfather. I know how those\npeople feel.
The regrets of those people who wanted to fly,\nbut couldn't.
And so, I...
'Mm... Nmmnnn...!'
Morning.
Awakened by the shrill alarm clock, I stretched\nmy whole body and tried to clear my bleary eyes.
Today's test flight would start this morning.
We didn't know how many more chances we'd have to\ntest the glider in favorable conditions before we\nset off for Morning Glory.

When we heard that today's weather conditions
would be perfect for a flight, we figured we
shouldn't count on the weather clearing up again
later.
We planned to get as many test flight results as\nwe could today.
'Aoiii! Are you awake?'
'...Hm? Asa?'
'Good morning, Aoi.'
Asa came into my room.
She'd already gotten dressed and everything.
'What is it? It looks like you're all ready to\ngo...'
'I just woke up early... It's about time to get\nup now, so I though I'd wake you up.'
'I must've woken up so early because I'm\nnervous...'
'You're really looking forward to flying, aren't\nyou?'
'Yes! My heart was already pounding when I went\nto bed last night. I couldn't sleep, and counted\nso many sheep...'
'Ahaha!'
That's so cute. Just like Asa.
'But thanks to being exhausted from what we did,\nI was able to fall asleep.'
'Drained... ahh, yea. Yea that's true.'
'E-ehehe. That's right.'
Asa's face grew red.
I, on the other hand, went back to my room and\nimmediately collapsed onto my bed after out\nencounter..
'I think I might have hurt myself a bit.'
'I-I'm sorry! It's my fault if that happened.'
'No no don't worry, I mean just muscle pains.\nIt's just creaking a bit from last night.'
'And plus...if I could, I would love to do it\nwith Asa everyday... I reckon.'
It's only early morning and we're already\nexperiencing awkward moments.
'A-anyway, I have to get myself ready! I'll go\ncheck up on the others!'
'O-okay!'
Asa hurriedly rushed out of the room.
...What are we doing?
I entered the dining room.
Asa and Yoru had already arrived, and were seated\nand sipping their tea.
'Ah, Aoi! You're ready?'
'Yeah. I washed my face and brushed my teeth, and\nI'm ready to go any time.'
'Good morning, Yoru.'
'Good morning, Aoi.'
'I see you got up early today, too.'
'I woke up when Sis did. She was making so much\nnoise beside me that I couldn't help but wake\nup...'
'Ahaha! I guess she woke you up, then.'
'Yes. Sis has been restless since last night. She\nwon't calm down.'
'Y, Yoru...'
'But it seems like she took an awfully long bath\nlate at night, so I suppose it's only natural\nthat she had trouble sleeping...'
'Right, Aoi?'
'...Why are you asking me?'
'No reason. I just thought you might have some\nexperience with that.'
Did Yoru know...?
'Oh, Sis didn't tell me anything. This is all\njust conjecture. A guess. Right, Sis? Am I\nright?'
'Ah, Ahahaha! ...I just took a long bath\nyesterday. Aoi wouldn't know anything about that.\nRight, Aoi?'
'O, of course not. There's no way I'd know...'
'(stare...)'
'N, nothing happened! Really!'
'(stare...)'
'Uuungh... He said nothing happened!'
'...Oh well. Whatever.'
...Whew.
At least she'd stopped questioning us.
'Nnngh... I can't keep my eyes open...'
At that point, Kotori came into the dining room\nwith a pained expression.
'Uwaah... Isn't this a bit too early? My head\nhurts... There's no way I could eat right now, so\nno breakfast for me, please...'
'Huh? You'll be fine ... we packed breakfast to\ntake with us. You can eat it when you get\nhungry.'
'Eh? Really? Oh yeah, that's why you were cooking\nwith Asa last night. I see...'
'That's right.'
'Here you are, Kotori. This is your share.'
'Yaay! Thanks, Aoi!'
'Morning, everyone!'
Just then, Kanako came into the room.
...In her underwear.
'Alright, I see that everyone's here, so if\nyou're all ready, let's go!'
'No no no...'
'Kanako, there is no way you're going like that.'
'Huh? Like what?'
'...You haven't noticed?'
'Huh? Noticed what?'
'Um, it's just, you're not... wearing any\nclothes...'
'...Oops. Guess I was still a bit sleepy.'
'Oh come on, nobody does that!'
First we went to the secret base to collect our\nglider.
'Morning, all!'
'Good morning.'
Amane and Ageha were already there.
Apparently Amane had taken the day off work to\njoin us.
'Look at that. Such a beautiful sky. This should\ngo well, don't you think?'
'Yeah. It's a perfect sky for flying.'
The beautiful clear sky wasn't entirely blue.\nThere were little spots of cloud dotted\nthroughout it, and just a bit of wind.
A completely still sky was no good for us, but\nthe same was true of a wild one. Today was\ndefinitely just right for a flight.
Apparently the god of the sky was smiling on us.
'Okay, let's get this glider out first.'
'Yeah.'
We went through the flight preparations, taking a\nbreak for breakfast partway through.
We attached the glider, checked the body, and\ndouble checked it several times.
I could see Ageha teaching Asa how to use the\nwinch, with Yoru watching by their side.

This would be their first flight, so there was a
lot they didn't know. Even if it would really be
just Kotori and Ageha using the winch, there was
certainly no harm in learning about it.
'We were just like that last year. Everything was\nall so new. We were so nervous.'
'Hmm? You're not nervous now, Kotori?'
'Of course I am.'
'...My heart's pounding so hard it might kill\nme.'
'What a coincidence. Mine too.'
I was so nervous I couldn't stop sweating.
'You're going to let Asa ride, right?'
'Hm? Why do you ask?'
'Well, I just think she really needs to ride.'
'Yeah? Why?'
'You know, her, and me, and...'
'Oh, I see you've already started.'
'Huh, Ma-bou?'
We hadn't noticed that a visitor had arrived.
'Looks like it's going smoothly.'
'Oh, and Akari too. Wait, have you come to watch\nus?!'
'Nope. It's not that I'm not interested in your\nflight, but today... We brought a visitor.'
'A visitor?'
'It's been a while, everyone.'
'Umm... Let's see... Weren't you...?'
'Long time no see!'
The visitors with Akari were the mother and son\nwe'd met before.
It was the boy that Asa and I had found crying\nduring our date, and his mother.
Apparently they'd figured out that we went to\nKeifuu Academy, based on the uniforms we'd been\nwearing.
'And we heard that you were active in the Soaring\nClub.'
'How did you figure that out? I'm amazed anyone\nknew who you were talking about.'

'The teachers asked around in the student
council. When everyone heard some distinguishing
details about you, they thought it must be you
two.'
'I didn't think we stood out all that much...'

'...A boy and a girl in uniform during summer
vacation were walking home from the old town to
Flying Fish Manor. Not only that, the boy
referred to the girl as 'Asa.''
'That makes it pretty obvious.'
...Yeah, it did.
'Anyway, that's how they figured it out. And they\nsaid they wanted to thank you.'
'Aaah... But there really was no need for you to\ngo so far out of your way...'
'No, no, if you don't let us thank you we'll feel\nhorrible. Here, have a box of cakes.'
'Aaaah... Uhh, thank you.'
'You too, Daichi. Say thanks.'
'Thank you, Mister!'
Then the little boy looked around him.
'Where is she?'
'Asaaaaaaaa!!'
Asa hadn't noticed the commotion over here, so I\nwaved and called out to her.
When she saw me, she jogged over to my side.
'H, hello! We haven't seen you in a while!'
'Yes, it's been a while.'
'H, hi!'
'They've come to thank us for that one time. They\neven gave us sweets.'
'Eeeeeh?! Th, that's... Thank you so much!'
'No, no, we're the ones who came to thank you, so\nplease don't bow your head to us!'
'But, you're too kind... We really didn't do\nanything...'
It was like watching a couple of housewives\nfalling over themselves to praise each other.
'Thank you too, Miss!'
The little boy bowed his head to Asa.
He seemed like a good kid.
'Did you learned to do a backwards flip?'
Asa asked the little boy.
'Not yet...'
'Oh, I see. Sorry.'
'He's really having trouble. He just can't seem\nto get it right.'
'...I think I'm gonna give up...'
'Y, you're still so young, if you keep it up\nyou'll get it someday!'
'Ahaha... It'd be nice if he learned how to\nsomeday.'
I guess he wasn't so good at sports.
There were a few kids in my class who couldn't do\nbackwards flips either.
'Everyone says that, so it's kinda frustrating.'
'Huh?'
'They say it's okay if I can't do it. But... I'm\njust so frustrated.'
'The teachers say it's normal, but I hate\nthat...'
No one had ever made a big deal out of failing to\ndo a backwards flip when I was a kid either.
But apparently a long time ago, it was such a\nshameful thing that teachers would coach a kid as\nlong as it took until he could do it.
But if they tried something like that now, the\nparents might get angry.
'Wha?! Miss, are you gonna fly in that?!'
The boy suddenly noticed the glider on the runway\nand asked about it.
His dark expression cleared instantly, and his\nface shone with excitement.
Little kids are so emotional, and their moods\nchange so quickly.
'Yeah... I mean, it's not for me to ride,\nspecifically...'
'No, you'll ride. You'll ride it, Sis.'
'Huh? Yoru?'
Yoru cut into the conversation.
'Wow!'
'Right, Sis?'
'I'm not gonna fly it though. I'll just go along\nfor a ride...'
'But you'll still fly, right?'
'Yeah. She's gonna fly.'
'... Wooowww! That's so amazing, Miss!'
'It's not... There's nothing amazing about me...'
'As long as we have these visitors here now, why\ndon't you go ahead and fly first, Asa?'
'We can let them watch you fly.'
'Huh? Me?'
'You can do a test flight with Aoi.'
Asa and I got into the cockpit.
I sat in front, and Asa got in behind me.
'Is... Is it really okay?'
Asa hesitated for a moment.
'I thought Ageha or Kotori would go first...'
I hadn't forgotten my promise with Kotori, but...

'We'd never decided anything like that. And she's
the one who suggested this. This isn't the main
flight or anything, so you don't need to worry so
much.'
'...Thank you.'
...Alright.
We carefully checked the yoke and the rudder\ncontrols.
We double-checked to make sure that nothing was\nout of order, and that our seatbelts were\nfastened tightly.
Alright. This should be okay.
'Okay over here. I'm going to close the canopy,\nAsa.'
'Ah, okay!'
The canopy closed over us.
I immediately checked the lock.
'The lock's okay.'
I reported to everyone outside.
'How does it feel, Aoi?'
'I have no idea - we haven't even started flying\nyet. But I guess it's going well so far.'
'Gotcha. Good luck!'
'Yeah.'
'Sis, it's the sky you've always longed for... Go\nup there and get your fill of it.'
'Y, yeah!'
'Wow! So cool! It's really gonna fly!'
'Oh my...'
'Everything's okay here too, Aoi.'
Kotori was handling the winch, and reported to me\nvia radio.
Now all that was left was to fly.
'Asa, that little boy is watching you.'
'Go up there with Aoi, and show him your dream!'
'...Okay.'
Asa nodded firmly behind me.
...Okay.
'Ageha, here's the sign.'
I signaled to Ageha outside.
She signaled on to Kotori. And then...
Vroom... The body jerked and started\naccelerating.
The frame rattled and shook as the glider sped\ndown the runway.
'Asa, I'm gonna show you the sky!'
'...Yeah!'
'Let's flyyyyy!!'
Whooshaaaaaa! The wind rushed past us.
The next thing I noticed, my whole view in front\nof us was filled with the blue sky.
'We're... flying...'
'I've confirmed the release of the towing gear\nunder the body.'
We should be able to fly just fine now.
'We... We're flying, Aoi!'
'Of course we are. This is a glider.'
We continued going up for a while, and then\nplateaued.
The body of the glider straightened out, and, now\nthat we were level, we could see the town of\nKazegaura spread out beneath us.
'Waaaa... The town looks so small...'
The glider kept flying forward, descending\nslightly.
Unless we used some thermal currents to fly back\nup again, we'd continue to sink down from now on.
'...It's incredible...'
It had been so long since I'd flown. The sky\nstretched out endlessly around us. It was\nexhilarating.
'...Even though there's no engine, we're really\nflying...'
'Yup, that's right.'
Whoooosh. From inside the canopy, we could hear\nthe sound of the glider cutting through the wind.
It felt like we were being held up by the sound\nitself.

'...It feels so strange to be able to fly through
the sky in such a little box. The sky feels so
much closer than when I'm in a regular plane.
It's like a slow rollercoaster.'
'Ahaha, that's a pretty good analogy.'
But this flight wasn't stuck to any rails.
I controlled the glider to keep it from sinking\ntoo fast, turning to the left and then the right,\nshowing off various moves.
'...We can really fly...'
'Yeah.'
'I'm looking at the sky... from the same height.\nFace to face.'
'...Yeah.'
'I never thought I'd be able to see this.'
She was looking at the sky, not up at it, but\nstraight on.
It was something that was only possible when she\nwas flying through it.
'...Do you want to try flying it?'
'Eeeeh?! No, I couldn't. I still don't...'
'But whenever you have free time during club\nhours, you always practice in the simulator,\nevery day, right?'
'Ah... Well, yes, but...'
'I thought it would be wonderful if I could fly\nmyself someday.'
'Try it, just a little. I'll tell you what to do,\nand if you make a mistake I'll cover for you.\nJust move it softly. Gently, okay?'
'I, in that case, just a little...'
'If... If we die, I'm so sorry...'
'We won't die. It's fine.'
I knew she was decent at flying the simulator,\nand I could always take over in a pinch.
I gave the controls over to Asa, for just a bit.
'Keep doing it just like I was, okay?'
'I'll try turning right...'
'Go for it.'
'...Like... Like this?'
Asa moved awkwardly, turning the yoke and the\nrudder.
Right.
Left.
She was a bit clumsy, and I jumped in to cover\nfor her several times, but Asa managed to slowly\nfly the glider.
'...Am I doing... okay?'
'Yeah, you're fine. I think you're well suited to\nthis.'
'Th, that's good... Ah!'
'Shall I take the controls again?'
'Y, yes, please!'
I took over the controls.
Asa sighed deeply. She must have been really\nnervous.
'You flew through the sky, you know.'
'It was just a little... And I let it sink a\nlot.'
'Then we can just go up again. Like this.'
I'd found a thermal current, so I flew onto it\nand raised our altitude.
The glider lifted up softly, and our view grew\nwider again.
'Ahaha, you're really great at this, Aoi!'
'Well, I've gotten pretty used to it by now. I've\nflown before.'
I'd even gotten a license.
'Aoi, this might be a bad time, but can I tell\nyou something?'
'What is it?'
'I... I never understood how a bird feels.'
'How a bird feels?'
'Yes. I thought that birds could never understand\nmy feelings either.'
'I felt so unsure. I felt like I was surrounded\nby nothing but birds, and was left behind, all by\nmyself.'
She must be talking about her family.
So many of them really excelled at what they did.\nShe was surrounded by talented people like Yoru.
'Birds are always looking at the sky. They're\nalways seeing this... This beautiful world. I\nthought it was absurd.'
'But?'
'I was okay, even without flying. I just...\nSomehow I understand that now.'
'It was because I couldn't fly, because this\nwasn't just my usual view, that this sky... that\nit looks so beautiful to me now.'
That's right. A person who could fly would never\nunderstand this feeling.
She could feel this because she couldn't fly.\nThat's why she could experience this luxury.
'I think I understand... why people crawl across\nthe land. I'm sure that's it.'
'It's so they can learn to fly.'
'...That must be it.'
Longing.
Envy.
Trying to grab something huge, to go somewhere\nhigh.
The world we yearned to fly freely through when\nwe were children was here before us now.
I couldn't think of anything better.
But if we'd been able to fly freely through it\never since we were small, we wouldn't be feeling\nthat wonderful sensation now.
'I think these heights can only be truly\nappreciated by people who know the bare earth.\nThat's why I crawled on the ground for so long .'
Asa could really understand it.
More than those around her, she could truly feel\nuplifted.
'I'm so happy. In such a short time, I was able\nto find two meanings of 'the best.''
'You, and this sky.'
'...I'm sorry. Saying such an embarrassing thing\nat a time like this.'
...Aaah, Asa was just too cute!
Saying that at a time like this made me even\nhappier!
'I... I think I've found one so far. If we reach\nMorning Glory, it'll be two.'
'...Let's make it a success.'
'Yeah.'
And maybe that little boy, watching this glider\nright now, can succeed with his backwards flip.
When he sees Asa, who used to be a crybaby like\nhim, flying through the sky, maybe he can find a\nlittle more courage.
I hoped for that as well.
'...Aoi, umm... Since we're surrounded by such a\nbeautiful sight, and it's such a special\nchance... Please let me say it again.'
'Hm?'
Asa seemed embarrassed, searching for words.
But I could guess what it was she wanted to say.
Words we'd said before, but still weren't used to\nsaying. She was trying to say them again now.
'Alright, I'll say it too. Let's say it\ntogether.'
'...Eh, ah, yeah... Okay!'
'...I love you!'
Up above the sky, the two of us pledged our love\nfor each other.
In the end, though, our Morning Glory plan\nfailed.
It hurts to say that efforts without results are\nworthless, but when it came down to it, we\nweren't able to reach the tunnel in the clouds.
Naturally, Kotori and Ageha and I, as well as our\nadvisor Amane, all felt dejected.

And Kanako, who'd joined us along the way, and
Akari, who checked up on us for the school
council, and of course Asa and Yoru were as
depressed as you'd expect.
If anyone at all was pleased, it could only have\nbeen Tobioka, And I'm not even sure about him.
But of course we were hungry for another chance,\nand waited for Morning Glory again the next year.
But even during our third and fourth summers, the\ncloud passage never came, and we graduated.
It was as though all the passion we'd poured into\nSoaring had amounted to nothing, and the curtain\ndropped too soon.
It was an unpleasant ending, with a gloomy\nfeeling left behind in our hearts.
Something happy happened, to clear the clouds\nfrom our hearts.
It happened...
Two years later.
'You're late!'
I arrived at the runway only to be yelled at by\nAsa.
'Sorry, sorry, I worked until really late last\nnight so I could get today off... I was planning\nto just take a short nap but I overslept.'
'Argh! You said you'd be able to get up yourself,\nso I let you try. I should have just gone to wake\nyou up after all!'
It's true - I probably should have just let her\ncome and wake me.
After all today was the big day.
The sky wouldn't wait for me to wake up.
'Well, Sis, he made it just in time, so it's\nokay. The preparations are all finished and\neveryone's here now.'
At that, I looked around me.
It looked like I was the last one to arrive.
Everyone else was already there, and was standing\naround chatting.
'Oh, Aoi! You're late!'
'Good morning, Kanako. I kind of overworked\nmyself last night...'
'Really? Asa looks well rested, though...'
'No, not that. At work.'
'Kana, you've got a dirty mind.'
'Ahaha! It was a joke!'
'But your work sounds really tough. You keep\ncoming here whenever you get a day off, too. Are\nyou getting enough rest?'
'It's the same with you. You come to every single\nflight.'
'Well, I wanna know how it goes.'
'So do I!'
'Then I guess it can't be helped.'
'Nope. Nothing to be done.'
Rather than just resting, I wanted to see as much\nas I could of this club's activity.
It must be because I loved it so much.
The first-year students were gathered around the\nwinch, learning how to use it.
They were junior members to Asa and Yoru.
'This all started with my own selfish plan... But\nit seems to have continued for quite some time.'
'That's right. Members may leave, but the club\nkeeps going.'
'It feels strange, like everyone's sharing the\nsky that Isuka was aiming for.'
'I never thought her dream would be shared by so\nmany people.'
'Kotori and I joined the same way. And even now\nwe keep coming to watch how the younger ones are\ndoing.'
'And I'm still the advisor.'
She smiled ironically.
It wasn't that we had any regrets. It was just\nthat this connection we shared made us happy, so\nwe kept coming back.
The glider had been upgraded and upgraded again.\nNow there were new wings attached to it.
And we'd heard rumors that the members of the\nrobot club had snuck past Tobioka to help with\nthe glider modifications.
'Morning Glory. I hope they can do it.'
'...I'm sure they'll make it through.'
We looked up at the sky to the east.
Last night, it had glowed bluish purple.
'They'll make it this year.'
'Sis, it's time. Let's ride.'
'Yeah.'
Asa and Yoru got into the glider.
Asa sat in front, with Yoru behind her.
They quickly went through all the checks, closed\nthe canopy, and prepared for takeoff.
'We'll do it this year.'
'Yeah, I'm counting on you!'
Amane's dream was passed on to us.
And from us, it was passed down to Asa and the\nothers.
It kept going on and on, continuing the challenge\nwith the sky.
We clung to the sky and kept dreaming.
Maybe it was feelings like these that motivated\npeople to develop the aviation technology used\nall around the world today.
...I couldn't help but think a few romantic\nthoughts like that.
'...Leave it to me! After all...'
'I was born to fly.'
And now, the girl who longed for the sky...
